extension.name: PLG_RS_PAYMENT_AMAZON
extension.author: redCOMPONENT.com
extension.description: This plugin enables standard Amazon Checkout payments

field.name: amazon_payment_method
field.label: Payment Method:
field.description: Using which payment method you want to use?

field.name: amazonPaymentsAccountId
field.label: Amazon Payment Account Id
field.description: Put your Amazon Payments Account Id here

field.name: amazon_recipientEmail
field.label: Recipient Email
field.description: This is the email Id associated with the Amazon payments account of the seller. Payment will be made to the seller who has registered this email Id with Amazon Payments. Note that the seller should have created an Amazon Payments Business account with this email Id for the payment to succeed.

field.name: verify_status
field.query: SELECT order_status_code AS st_value, order_status_name AS st_title FROM #__redshop_order_status
field.label: Order Status for successful transactions
field.description: Select the order status to which the actual order is set, if the payment transaction was successful.

field.name: invalid_status
field.query: SELECT order_status_code AS st_value, order_status_name AS st_title FROM #__redshop_order_status
field.label: Order Status for failed transactions
field.description: Select an order status for failed payment transactions.

field.name: capture_status
field.query: SELECT order_status_code AS st_value, order_status_name AS st_title FROM #__redshop_order_status
field.label: Capture Payment Status
field.description: Select an capture status for capturing payment.

field.name: amazon_variable_marketplace_fee
field.label: Variable Marketplace fee
field.description: Only for Marketplace Method.Marketplace Fee. This is the fee that you want to charge to the sellers for using your website / application. The fee can either be fixed (e.g. 0.20 USD), variable (e.g. 4%) or a combination (e.g.4% + 0.20 USD). You can charge a different fee for every payment as long as it is lesser than the maximum fee specified in the fee policy accepted by the seller. If the marketplace fee is more than the fee accepted by the seller, you have to get the seller accept the updated fee policy before the transaction can succeed.

field.name: amazon_fixed_marketplace_fee
field.label: Fixed Marketplace fee
field.description: Only for Marketplace Method.Marketplace Fee. This is the fee that you want to charge to the sellers for using your website / application. The fee can either be fixed (e.g. 0.20 USD), variable (e.g. 4%) or a combination (e.g.4% + 0.20 USD). You can charge a different fee for every payment as long as it is lesser than the maximum fee specified in the fee policy accepted by the seller. If the marketplace fee is more than the fee accepted by the seller, you have to get the seller accept the updated fee policy before the transaction can succeed.
